asiri - (08/10/2008 17:45): ok,  
vmassol - (08/10/2008 17:45): and we can use Exo's JCR  
amelentev1 - (08/10/2008 17:45): I'm not sure all webdav features will work on jcr without your work  
vmassol - (08/10/2008 17:46): then what code do we need to write to support wbedav?

vmassol - (08/10/2008 17:46): since Exo supports webdav  
vmassol - (08/10/2008 17:46): it can be access through all dav clients  
asiri - (08/10/2008 17:46): in that case to expose a jcr repository via webdav, i think there should be existing implementations (since this is common) ...

asiri - (08/10/2008 17:48): what's going on ...  
vmassol - (08/10/2008 17:48): just ludo's bot not working fine  
vmassol - (08/10/2008 17:48): ok so back to the topic  
vmassol - (08/10/2008 17:48): so the advantage of rewriting webdav support  
vmassol - (08/10/2008 17:48): is only to be independent of our storage  
amelentev1 - (08/10/2008 17:49): + some additional features  
vmassol - (08/10/2008 17:49): (which is probably important)  
amelentev1 - (08/10/2008 17:49): like /space/letter/letter/docname  
vmassol - (08/10/2008 17:49): ok so if we made JCR our way of using any storage solution  
vmassol - (08/10/2008 17:49): then it's less useful  
vmassol - (08/10/2008 17:50): amelentev1: I see  
asiri - (08/10/2008 17:51): i really need to understand what's going on with JCR ... btw, ludovic should have a word regarding this too, since he initially desgined current webdav approach ..  
vmassol - (08/10/2008 17:51): btw asiri, did you check out nuxeo?  
asiri - (08/10/2008 17:51): no  
vmassol - (08/10/2008 17:52): some interesting doc here: http://doc.nuxeo.org/5.1/books/nuxeo-book/html/nuxeo-platform-webdav-server.html  
vmassol - (08/10/2008 17:52): (I guess we have the same pbs as the ones mentioned)

asyd - (08/10/2008 17:53): heya vmassol! we met howard lee (from tapestry5) yesterday evening. I notice you know him (at least you're connected in linkedin ;p)  you really should live more closer than paris ;p  
vmassol - (08/10/2008 17:53): asyd: yes I know him...  
vmassol - (08/10/2008 17:54): we've met several times

vmassol - (08/10/2008 17:57): :)

asiri - (08/10/2008 17:59): amelentev1: can you explain a bit about JCR, how things will change with it .. in webdav ?  
asiri - (08/10/2008 18:00): :)  
asiri - (08/10/2008 18:00): i mean currently i use XWikiContext.get\*\*\*\* methods to retrieve documents that is to be exposed via webdav ..  
asiri - (08/10/2008 18:00): how this would change with jcr ..  
asiri - (08/10/2008 18:00): i'm totally new to this .. :)  
amelentev1 - (08/10/2008 18:01): major change in jcr webdav is you don't need get  xwiki documents, attachments :) It is loaded automatically from jcr repo  
asiri - (08/10/2008 18:02): oh ... i have no clue .. how does that happen ? is that a lengthly description ? any resources i might refer to ? :)  
amelentev1 - (08/10/2008 18:02): in jcr we have some hierarchy, and this hierarchy is directly  exposed in webdav  
asiri - (08/10/2008 18:03): i see, in that case existing webdav code have little or no use ... don't you think ? :-?  
amelentev1 - (08/10/2008 18:04): I think browser problems will remain  
amelentev1 - (08/10/2008 18:05): and we can't change urls. urls is tethered to hierarchy  
xwikibot - (08/10/2008 18:05): Main.Documentation was modified by xwiki:XWiki.jvelociter (Initial draft) - http://workspaces.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Documentation  
amelentev1 - (08/10/2008 18:06): but I think it is possible to rewrite urls via some webdav proxy  
asiri - (08/10/2008 18:07): with jcr, how webdav server is built ? is is ready made ? like is there an already built webdav server ?  
asiri - (08/10/2008 18:08): ah yes ..  
asiri - (08/10/2008 18:08): we can use the jackrabbit jcr webdav server ..  
xwikibot - (08/10/2008 18:09): Main.Documentation was modified by xwiki:XWiki.jvelociter (Corrected link) - http://workspaces.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Documentation  
amelentev1 - (08/10/2008 18:09): yes  
amelentev1 - (08/10/2008 18:09): some info here http://wiki.apache.org/jackrabbit/WebDAV  
asiri - (08/10/2008 18:10): so the question is now what ? :(  
amelentev1 - (08/10/2008 18:10): But i'm not tried it  
asiri - (08/10/2008 18:10): i'm pretty sure it'll work with our jcr (since jcr is an standard) ..  
xwikibot - (08/10/2008 18:11): Main.Documentation was modified by xwiki:XWiki.jvelociter (typo) - http://workspaces.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Documentation  
amelentev1 - (08/10/2008 18:13): There can be some problems if we change some resource directly in webdav/jcr, without notifying the core   
amelentev1 - (08/10/2008 18:15): ah, there is jcr observations for this case  
asiri - (08/10/2008 18:15): current webdav implementation anyways go through the core. The problem is whether we should go for jcr webdav server or a generic webdav server ... and why ... i'm kind of stuck here ..  
asiri - (08/10/2008 18:16): how is jcr comming up ? was it implemented at the time where we started xwiki-webdav ? I hope not .. :)  
asiri - (08/10/2008 18:17): because if we had jcr at that time we shouldn't have opted for a separate webdav implementation as we have now ... i wonder if we'd have to dump all efforts on webdav (what we have now) :(  
amelentev1 - (08/10/2008 18:19): This feature was in jackrabbit/exo since almost beginning. But we haven't a normal JCRStorage for use it  
asiri - (08/10/2008 18:19): yes, true ..  
asiri - (08/10/2008 18:20): so webdav should have followed jcr .. but we had them parallel is it the case ? :)  
amelentev1 - (08/10/2008 18:21): yes :)  
asiri - (08/10/2008 18:22): i wonder what we can do now ... think we'll have to wait for vincent's advice on this ..  
asiri - (08/10/2008 18:24): amelentev1 : Shall i start a discussion on the list about this conflict ?
